javadoc: This plugin provides the interactive Python interpreter.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a new PythonPlugin object.
@param tool The tool associated with this plugin.
methods.name: <init>

params.name: tool
params.comment: The tool associated with this plugin.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the plugin's interpreter console.
@return The plugin's interpreter console.
methods.name: getConsole

methods.javadoc:
Gets the plugin's Python interpreter.
@return The plugin's Python interpreter.  May be null.
methods.name: getInterpreter

return.comment: The plugin's Python interpreter.  May be null.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the plugin's interactive script
@return The plugin's interactive script.
methods.name: getInteractiveScript

methods.javadoc:
Gets the plugin's interactive task monitor.
@return The plugin's interactive task monitor.
methods.name: getInteractiveTaskMonitor
methods.comment: Gets the plugin's interactive task monitor.

methods.javadoc: Creates various actions for the plugin.
methods.name: createActions
methods.comment: Creates various actions for the plugin.

methods.javadoc:
Resets the interpreter to a new starting state. This is used when the plugin is first initialized, as well as when an existing interpreter receives a Python exit command. We used to try to reset the same interpreter, but it was really hard to do that correctly so we now just create a brand new one.

NOTE: Loading Jython for the first time can be quite slow the first time, so we do this when the user wants to first interact with the interpreter (rather than when the plugin loads).
methods.name: resetInterpreter
methods.comment:
Resets the interpreter to a new starting state.  This is used when the plugin is first
 initialized, as well as when an existing interpreter receives a Python exit command.
 We used to try to reset the same interpreter, but it was really hard to do that correctly
 so we now just create a brand new one.
 
 NOTE: Loading Jython for the first time can be quite slow the first time, so we do this
 when the user wants to first interact with the interpreter (rather than when the plugin loads).

methods.name: optionsChanged
methods.comment: Handle a change in one of our options.

methods.name: getCompletions
methods.comment: Returns a list of possible command completion values.

return.comment: A list of possible command completion values.  Could be empty if there aren't any.

methods.javadoc: Interrupts what the interpreter is currently doing.
methods.name: interrupt
methods.comment: Interrupts what the interpreter is currently doing.

methods.javadoc: Prints a welcome message to the console.
methods.name: welcome
methods.comment: Prints a welcome message to the console.

name: PythonPlugin
comment: This plugin provides the interactive Python interpreter.

fields.name: INCLUDE_BUILTINS_DESCRIPTION
fields.constant_value: "Whether or not to include Python's built-in functions and properties in the pop-up code completion window."
